page.title: 07The Community
page.content: There are two main settlements that provide the focus of community life in this area.The village of Gweek which lies to the south of the grid area and the village of Trewennack on the eastern border. Gweek has a larger population than Trewennack and a more extended community network.i.e. a brass band, football club, playgroup, dramatic society, whereas Trewennack is now without a shop of any kind and the only focus of this large hamlet rather than vilage is the methodist chapel.As a consequence 'Trewennackers' tend to link more closely with the nearby town of Helston. The common element shared by these two groups is the primary school placed at an equal distance between the two as a result of historical rather than educational developments.
